title: Create TUI data models and eliminate direct SDK type usage
description:
**As a** Consoul developer
**I want** TUI widgets to use simple TUI-specific data models instead of SDK types
**So that** TUI is decoupled from SDK internal changes and has cleaner interfaces

**Context:**
Currently, TUI widgets receive complex SDK types (BaseChatModel, ToolMetadata, ParsedToolCall, etc.) which creates tight coupling. Best practice for layered architecture is:
- SDK Layer: Business logic, complex types, LangChain integration
- TUI Layer: UI rendering, simple display models, Textual widgets

This ticket creates src/consoul/tui/models.py with simple dataclasses for TUI display, then updates widgets to use them. This:
- Decouples TUI from SDK type changes
- Simplifies widget interfaces
- Makes widgets easier to test (no SDK mocking needed)
- Enables better separation of concerns

**Current State:**
- Widgets import SDK types directly
- MessageBubble, ToolCallWidget, etc. receive complex objects
- ~56 SDK imports scattered across tui/ directory
- Type hints expose SDK internals to UI code

**Target State:**
- TUI data models in src/consoul/tui/models.py:
  - MessageDisplay: Simple message data for UI
  - ToolCallDisplay: Tool call visualization data
  - ModelDisplay: Model info for picker/display
  - ConversationDisplay: Conversation metadata
- Widgets accept only TUI models
- App.py converts SDK → TUI models at boundary
- SDK imports reduced from 56 to <20

**Technical Notes:**
- Create new: src/consoul/tui/models.py
- Define: MessageDisplay, ToolCallDisplay, ModelDisplay, etc. as @dataclass
- Update: All widgets in src/consoul/tui/widgets/ to accept TUI models
- Update: app.py to convert SDK types → TUI models before passing to widgets
- Remove: Unnecessary SDK imports from widgets
- Keep: Essential imports (ConversationService, Config types)
- Pattern: SDK → TUI conversion happens in app.py only

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** TUI data models exist
**When** I review widget signatures
**Then** All widgets accept only TUI models, not SDK types

**Given** MessageBubble needs data
**When** App creates it
**Then** App converts AIMessage → MessageDisplay before passing

**Given** ToolCallWidget needs data
**When** Tool execution completes
**Then** App converts ToolMessage → ToolCallDisplay

**Given** Model picker needs data
**When** Modal opens
**Then** App converts ModelInfo → ModelDisplay list

**Given** TUI models are used
**When** I count SDK imports in tui/
**Then** Count is reduced from 56 to <20

**Testing Considerations:**
- Test widget rendering with TUI models
- Verify all message types display correctly
- Test tool call visualization
- Test model picker functionality
- Verify conversation history loads
- Check that no SDK types leak into widgets
- Test type checking passes (mypy)

**Implementation Hints:**

Create tui/models.py with:
```python
from dataclasses import dataclass
from datetime import datetime

@dataclass
class MessageDisplay:
    content: str
    role: str  # "user" | "assistant" | "system"
    timestamp: datetime
    token_count: int | None = None
    thinking_content: str | None = None
    # ... display-specific fields only

@dataclass
class ToolCallDisplay:
    name: str
    arguments: dict
    status: str  # "SUCCESS" | "ERROR" | "PENDING"
    result: str | None = None
    # ... display-specific fields only

@dataclass  
class ModelDisplay:
    id: str
    name: str
    provider: str
    context_window: int
    supports_vision: bool
    # ... display-specific fields only
```

Update widgets:
- MessageBubble.__init__(message: MessageDisplay, ...)
- ToolCallWidget.__init__(tool_call: ToolCallDisplay, ...)
- ModelPickerModal: Accept list[ModelDisplay]

Add conversion in app.py:
- _to_message_display(ai_message: AIMessage) → MessageDisplay
- _to_tool_display(tool_message: ToolMessage) → ToolCallDisplay
- _to_model_displays(models: list[ModelInfo]) → list[ModelDisplay]

Expected line reduction: ~100-200 lines (simplified widgets, removed imports)
